channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Fed keeps interest rates steady. And, U.S. plans to deport migrants to Libya
item.description: The Federal Reserve held interest rates steady amid uncertainty over President Trump's trade war. And, the Trump administration has plans to deport mi...

item.title: Once-fringe activists are fighting to be the voice of the anti-abortion movement
item.description: Most Americans balk at the idea of charging women who get abortions with homicide, but post- Roe , militant anti-abortion activists are finding state ...

item.title: Glittering blue creatures are washing up on California beaches. Here's why
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of Velella velella , more commonly known as by-the-wind-sailors, are drifting onto the coastline. Beachcombers say they look lik...

item.title: Discovering a mom we never knew, in letters she saved from WWII soldiers
item.description: My sister and I recently unearthed a forgotten box of correspondence our mom received from servicemen she'd met at Red Cross dances in Rome near the e...

item.title: No new pope elected yet after black smoke pours out of Sistine Chapel's chimney
item.description: Black smoke streamed from the chimney of the Sistine Chapel on Thursday morning in Rome, signaling that the 133 cardinal electors have not come to a t...

item.title: Deadly April rainfall in US South and Midwest was intensified by climate change, scientists say
item.description: Human-caused climate change intensified deadly rainfall in Kentucky, Tennessee, Arkansas and other states in early April and made it more likely to oc...

item.title: Smokey Robinson denies sexual assault allegations
item.description: In a statement, the singer's lawyer says the abuse allegations are an attempt to "extract money".

item.title: U.S. and U.K. expected to announce what Trump has called "major trade deal"
item.description: The U.S. and U.K. are expected to announce what President Trump has called a "major trade deal" that's "full and comprehensive."

item.title: Watch: Moments past conclaves elected new popes
item.description: See the moments previous popes were elected by conclaves past, from 1939 to 2013.

item.title: Smokey Robinson’s lawyer says rape allegations against him are ‘vile’ and ‘false’
Alligator attacks, kills woman canoeing with her husband in Florida
item.description: An alligator killed a Florida woman after tipping over a canoe she and her husband were paddling, investigators said.

item.title: Soviet spacecraft is plunging back to Earth 53 years after launch
item.description: A Soviet-era spacecraft meant to land on Venus a half century ago is expected to plunge uncontrolled back to Earth within days.

item.title: At least 2 injured in Columbia University protest, dozens in custody
item.description: NYPD officers took dozens of pro-Palestinian demonstrators into custody at Columbia University's Butler Library on Wednesday evening.

item.title: To fix Newark delays, FAA should take these steps, United CEO says
item.description: The FAA says it's taking immediate steps to alleviate the delays at Newark Airport​ that began more than a week ago​.

item.title: Israel PM 'uncertain' over condition of three Gaza hostages
item.description: Benjamin Netanyahu said he knew "with certainty" that 21 hostages were alive but the status of "three more" were unclear.

item.title: Civil rights leaders say acquittals in Tyre Nichols’ death highlight the need for police reform
US judge blocks plan to deport migrants to Libya
item.description: The order comes after lawyers expressed alarm that the US was planning to deport migrants to the North African country "immediately".

item.title: Dozens of pro-Palestinian protesters arrested at Columbia University
item.description: The university asked for police help after protesters occupied part of the main library on Wednesday.
